measured_by: percentage of responses aligned with base-rate information on incongruent base-rate problems
justification: “We defined participant rationality as the percentage of responses that were made based on likelihood…We determined the percentage of rational responses as the percentage of times participants responded in line with the base-rate information on incongruent trials.”

measured_by: frontal theta (4–8 Hz) power at electrode FCz recorded with EEG
justification: “We…found that increased power in this frequency range was associated with increased rationality…our principal finding was that frontal theta oscillations predicted rationality, …indicating theta activity is a neural measure of rationality.”
